summary: Water quality parameters are stable but pH is slightly below optimal range for Blue Nile tilapia.

insights.recommendation: Consider adjusting pH to maintain it between 7.0 and 8.0 for optimal fish health.
Maintain TDS levels; they are within acceptable range for both fish and plants.
Continue monitoring temperature; it is within the suitable range for Blue Nile tilapia.

extended_notes:
Last 7 days overview:
• pH avg/min/max: 7.057 / 7.025 / 7.08 (trend: up)
• TDS avg/min/max: 306.441 / 295.1 / 347.6 ppm (trend: down)
• Temp avg/min/max: 28.866 / 27.25 / 30.06 °C (trend: up)

Actions (if needed):
• pH: keep ~6.6–7.2; calibrate probe with 7.00/4.01; adjust slowly.
• TDS: seedlings ~200–500 ppm; higher OK for mature plants; water-change to reduce.
• Temp: hold in target band for your fish/plants; heater/chiller/aeration as needed.
